target_content: Halve the amount of residual (non-recycled) municipal waste
NACE_level1: E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level2: E38 - Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities, materials recovery
justification: This target focuses on waste management and recycling, making it relevant to NACE category E38.

target_content: Union's access to a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials by ensuring that the Union's recycling capacity, including for all intermediate recycling steps, is able to produce at least 15% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials
NACE_level1: B - Mining and Quarrying
NACE_level2: B9 - Mining support service activities
NACE_level2_extra1: C33 - Repair and installation of machinery and equipment
NACE_level_3: C33.2 - Installation of industrial machinery and equipment
NACE_level_3_extra1: B9.9 - Support activities for other mining and quarrying
justification: Focus on recycling capacity for strategic raw materials indicates relevance to both mining and manufacturing sectors.

target_content: Diversify the Union's imports of strategic raw materials with a view to ensure that the Union's annual consumption of each strategic raw material at any relevant stage of processing can rely on imports from several third countries, none of which provide more than 65% of the Union's annual consumption
NACE_level1: B - Mining and Quarrying
NACE_level2: B7 - Mining of metal ores
NACE_level_3_extra1: B8.1 - Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
justification: Focus on diversification and importation of raw materials ties it closely to the mining sector.

target_content: by 2030, manufacturing capacity in the Union of the strategic net-zero technologies listed in the Annex approaches or reaches a benchmark of at least 40% of the Union’s annual deployment needs for the corresponding technologies necessary to achieve the Union’s 2030 climate and energy targets
NACE_level1: C - Manufacturing
NACE_level2: C30 - Manufacture of other transport equipment
NACE_level_3: C30.3 - Manufacture of air and spacecraft and related machinery
NACE_level_3_extra1: C27.4 - Manufacture of electric lighting equipment
justification: Emphasis on manufacturing capacity for net-zero technologies relates directly to the manufacturing sector.

target_content: nan
justification: No content provided

target_content: nan
justification: No content provided

target_content: Producers of portable batteries or, where appointed in accordance with Article 57(1), producer responsibility organisations, shall ensure that all waste portable batteries, Light Means of Transport (LMT) and SLI batteries, regardless of their nature, chemical composition, condition, brand or origin, are collected separately in the territory of a Member State where they make these batteries available on the market for the first time.
NACE_level1: E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level2: E38 - Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities, materials recovery
justification: Emphasis on collection of waste batteries indicates relevance to waste management activities.

target_content: Producers of portable batteries or producer responsibility organisations, shall attain, and maintain durably, at least the following collection targets for waste portable batteries: 45 % by 31 December 2023, 63 % by 31 December 2027, 73 % by 31 December 2030.
NACE_level1: E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level2: E38 - Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities, materials recovery
justification: Focus on collection targets for waste batteries aligns with waste management activities.

target_content: Producers of LMT (Light Means of Transport) batteries or producer responsibility organisations, shall attain, and maintain durably, at least the following collection targets of waste LMT batteries: 51 % by 31 December 2028, 61 % by 31 December 2031.
NACE_level1: E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level2: E38 - Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities, materials recovery
justification: The target of collecting waste LMT batteries connects with waste management activities.

target_content: Recycled content in industrial batteries, electric vehicle batteries, LMT batteries and SLI batteries: Cobalt:  16 % by 2031 (26% by 2036), Lead: 85% (85%), Nickel: 6% (12%), Lithium 6% (15%)
NACE_level1: C - Manufacturing
NACE_level2: C27 - Manufacture of electrical equipment
NACE_level2_extra1: C29 - Manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers
NACE_level_3: C29.3 - Manufacture of parts and accessories for motor vehicles
justification: The target is about recycled content in batteries, linking it to electrical equipment and motor vehicle manufacturing.

target_content: All batteries incorporated in market products shall be readily removable and replaceable by the end-user at any time during the lifetime (except some derogations)
NACE_level1: C - Manufacturing
NACE_level2: C27 - Manufacture of electrical equipment
NACE_level2_extra2: C27.1 - Manufacture of electric motors, generators, transformers and electricity distribution and control apparatus
justification: The focus on battery design for removability aligns with electrical equipment manufacturing.

target_content: Reduce landfill to a maximum of 10% of municipal waste
NACE_level1: E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level2: E38 - Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities, materials recovery
justification: The emphasis on reducing landfill highlights the role of waste management.

target_content: Recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recycling efficiency: No later than 31 December 2025 - 75% by average weight of lead-acid batteries, - 80% by average weight of nickel-cadmium batteries - 50% by average weight of other waste batteries No later than 31 December 2030 - 80% by average weight of lead-acid batteries,E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level1_extra2: E38 - Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities, materials recovery
justification: The focus on recycling efficiency for batteries is clearly tied to waste management activities.

target_content: Recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recycling efficiency: No later than 31 December 2025 - 65% by average weight of lithium-based batteries, No later than 31 December 2030 - 70% by average weight of lithium-based batteries
NACE_level1: E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level2: E38 - Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities, materials recovery
justification: Recycling efficiency targets for lithium-based batteries relate to waste management activities.

target_content: All recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recovery of materials: No later than 31 December 2027 -90% for cobalt, copper, lead and nickel, No later than 31 December 2031: -95% for cobalt, copper, lead, and nickel,
NACE_level1: E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level2: E38 - Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities, materials recovery
justification: The targets for material recovery emphasize the role of waste management activities.

target_content: All recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recovery of materials: No later than 31 December 2027 -50% lithium No later than 31 December 2031: -80% lithium
NACE_level1: E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level2: E38 - Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities, materials recovery
justification: Material recovery targets for lithium focus on waste management activities.

target_content: Reduce the generation of food waste in processing and manufacturing by 10% in comparison to the amount generated in 2020
NACE_level1: C - Manufacturing
NACE_level2: C10 - Manufacture of food products
NACE_level2_extra2: C10.8 - Manufacture of other food products
justification: The target of reducing food waste ties to the manufacturing of food products.

target_content: Reduce the generation of food waste per capita, jointly in retail and other distribution of food, in restaurants and food services and in households, by 30 % in comparison to the amount generated in 2020
NACE_level1: G - Wholesale and Retail Trade, Repair of Motor Vehicles and Motorcycles
NACE_level1_extra1: I - Accommodation and Food Service Activities
NACE_level2: G47 - Retail trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
NACE_level2_extra1: I56 - Food and beverage service activities
NACE_level_3: I56.1 - Restaurants and mobile food service activities
justification: The target addresses food waste reduction across retail, distribution, and food services.

target_content: nan
justification: No content provided

target_content: Making all packaging recyclable (see European Parliament resolution of 10 February 2021 on the New Circular Economy Action Plan, the New Circular Economy Action Plan and art. 5 of this Proposal)
NACE_level1: C - Manufacturing
NACE_level2: C22 - Manufacture of rubber and plastic products
justification: The focus on recyclable packaging aligns with manufacturing of plastic products.

target_content: The plastic part in packaging shall contain the following minimum percentage of recycled content recovered from post-consumer plastic waste, per unit of packaging: From 1 January 2030 (i) 30% for contact sensitive packaging made from polyethylene terephthalate (PET) as major component, (ii) 10% for contact sensitive made from plastic materials other than PET, except single use plastic bottles, (iii) 30% for single use plastic beverage bottles, (iv) 35% for other plastic packaging From 1 January 2040 (v) 50% for contact sensitive plastic packaging, except single use plastic beverage bottles, (vi) 65% for single use plastic beverage bottles, (vii) 65% for other plastic packaging
NACE_level1: C - Manufacturing
NACE_level2: C22 - Manufacture of rubber and plastic products
justification: Minimum recycled content requirements for plastic packaging relate to manufacturing of plastic products.

target_content: Member States shall take measures to achieve a sustained reduction in the consumption of lightweight plastic carrier bags on their territory. A sustained reduction is achieved if the annual consumption does not exceed 40 lightweight plastic carrier bags per person, or the equivalent target in weight, by 31 December 2025, and subsequently by 31 December in each year thereafter
NACE_level1: C - Manufacturing
NACE_level1_extra1: G - Wholesale and Retail Trade, Repair of Motor Vehicles and Motorcycles
NACE_level2: C22 - Manufacture of rubber and plastic products
NACE_level2_extra1: G47 - Retail trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
justification: The target for reducing plastic bag consumption involves both manufacturing and retail sectors.

target_content: Double its circular material use rate in the coming decade
NACE_level1: C - Manufacturing
NACE_level1_extra1: E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level2: C32 - Other manufacturing
NACE_level2_extra1: E38 - Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities, materials recovery
justification: The emphasis on circular material use includes manufacturing and waste management.

target_content: Reduce packaging waste by 5% per Member State per capita compared to 2018 by 2030, 10% by 2035 and 15% by 2040
NACE_level1: C - Manufacturing
NACE_level2: C22 - Manufacture of rubber and plastic products
justification: The target of reducing packaging waste ties to the manufacturing of packaging materials.

target_content: Recycling or preparing for re-use 65% of all packaging waste by 2025, 70% by 2030
NACE_level1: E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level2: E38 - Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities, materials recovery
justification: The focus on recycling packaging waste aligns with waste management activities.

target_content: Recycling of plastic in packaging: 55%
NACE_level1: E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level2: E38 - Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities, materials recovery
justification: The target for recycling plastic packaging is relevant to waste management.

target_content: Recycling of wood in packaging: 30%
NACE_level1: E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level2: E38 - Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities, materials recovery
justification: The target for recycling wood packaging is connected to waste management.

target_content: Recycling of ferrous metals in packaging: 80%
NACE_level1: E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level2: E38 - Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities, materials recovery
justification: The target for recycling ferrous metals in packaging relates to waste management.

target_content: Recycling of aluminium in packaging: 60%
NACE_level1: E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level2: E38 - Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities, materials recovery
justification: The target for recycling aluminum packaging aligns with waste management.

target_content: Recycling of glass in packaging: 75%
NACE_level1: E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level2: E38 - Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities, materials recovery
justification: The focus on recycling glass packaging connects to waste management activities.

target_content: Recycling of paper and cardboard in packaging: 85%
NACE_level1: E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level2: E38 - Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities, materials recovery
justification: The target for recycling paper and cardboard packaging is related to waste management.

target_content: nan
justification: No content provided

target_content: From 2025, beverage bottles listed in Part F of the Annex which are manufactured from polyethylene terephthalate as the major component (‘PET bottles’) contain at least 25 % recycled plastic, calculated as an average for all PET bottles placed on the market on the territory of that Member State
NACE_level1: C - Manufacturing
NACE_level2: C22 - Manufacture of rubber and plastic products
justification: The target for recycled content in PET bottles is linked to manufacturing of plastic products.

target_content: By 2030 textile products placed on the EU market are long-lived and recyclable, to a great extent made of recycled fibres, free of hazardous substances and produced in respect of social rights and the environment
NACE_level1: C - Manufacturing
NACE_level2: C13 - Manufacture of textiles
justification: This target focuses on textile sustainability, relating to textile manufacturing.

target_content: Member States shall meet the target of 77% by weight for the separate collection for recycling of waste single-use plastic beverage bottles by 2025 and 90% by 2029
NACE_level1: E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level2: E38 - Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities, materials recovery
justification: The target for recycling plastic bottles is associated with waste management activities.

target_content: From 2019, the minimum collection rate to be achieved annually shall be 65 % of the average weight of EEE placed on the market in the three preceding years in the Member State concerned, or alternatively 85 % of WEEE generated on the territory of that Member State.
NACE_level1: E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level2: E38 - Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities, materials recovery
justification: The target for collection of WEEE is linked to waste management activities.

target_content: From 15 August 2018, the recovery targets for the WEEE falling within the following categories of Annex III shall be: - 85% for Category 1 (temperature exchange equipment) or Category 4 (large equipment with any external dimension more than 50 cm) - 80% for Category 2 (e.g., screens and monitors) - 75% for Category 5 (small equipment with no external dimension more than 50 cm) or 6 (Small IT and telecommunication equipment with no external dimension more than 50 cm).
NACE_level1: E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level2: E38 - Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities, materials recovery
justification: The target for recovery of WEEE relates to waste management activities.

target_content: From 15 August 2018, the preparation for re-use targets for the WEEE falling within the following categories of Annex III shall be: - 80% for Category 1 or Category 4 - 70% for Category 2 - 55% for Category 5 or Category 6
NACE_level1: E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level2: E38 - Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities, materials recovery
justification: The target for preparation for re-use of WEEE connects to waste management activities.

target_content: From 15 August 2018, the recycling targets for the WEEE falling within the following categories of Annex III shall be: - 0% for Category 1 or Category 4 - 70% for Category 2 - 55% for Category 5 or Category 6
NACE_level1: E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level2: E38 - Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities, materials recovery
justification: The target for recycling WEEE falls under waste management activities.

target_content: By 2025, the preparing for re-use and recycling of municipal waste shall be increased to a minimum of 55% by weight (60% by 2030, 65% by 2035)
NACE_level1: E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level2: E38 - Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities, materials recovery
justification: The focus on municipal waste recycling and re-use aligns with waste management activities.

target_content: Member States should aim to achieve an indicative Union-wide food waste reduction target of 30 % by 2025 and 50 % by 2030
NACE_level1: G - Wholesale and Retail Trade, Repair of Motor Vehicles and Motorcycles
NACE_level1_extra1: I - Accommodation and Food Service Activities
NACE_level2: G47 - Retail trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
NACE_level2_extra1: I56 - Food and beverage service activities
NACE_level_3: I56.1 - Restaurants and mobile food service activities
justification: The target for food waste reduction spans retail and food service sectors.

target_content: Hazardous household waste will have to be collected separately by 2022, bio-waste by 2023 and textiles by 2025
NACE_level1: E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level2: E38 - Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities, materials recovery
justification: The separate collection of various waste types is clearly linked to waste management activities.

target_content: nan
justification: No content provided

target_content: By 2030 producers will have responsibility for their products along the value chain, including when they become waste. The circular textiles ecosystem is thriving, driven by sufficient capacities for innovative fibre-to-fibre recycling, while the incineration and landfilling of textiles is reduced to the minimum.
NACE_level1: C - Manufacturing
NACE_level2: C13 - Manufacture of textiles
justification: The focus on textiles recycling and producer responsibility relates to textile manufacturing.

target_content: nan
justification: No content provided

target_content: nan
justification: No content provided

target_content: Union's access to a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials by ensuring that the Union's extraction capacity is able to extract the ores, minerals or concentrates needed to produce at least 10% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials, to the extent that the Union’s reserves allow for this
NACE_level1: B - Mining and Quarrying
NACE_level2: B7 - Mining of metal ores
NACE_level_3_extra1: B8.1 - Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
justification: The target for extraction capacity directly relates to the mining sector.

target_content: Union's access to a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials by ensuring that the Union's processing capacity, including for all intermediate processing steps, is able to produce at least 40% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials
NACE_level1: B - Mining and Quarrying
NACE_level2: B7 - Mining of metal ores
NACE_level_3_extra1: B8.1 - Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
justification: The focus on processing capacity for raw materials links closely to mining activities.
